title: Power Up Rules
description: Rules that generally make players stronger and make the game speed up.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 2-for-1 wood conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on the wood port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 2-for-1 brick conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on the brick port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 2-for-1 sheep conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on the sheep port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 2-for-1 wheat conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on the wheat port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 2-for-1 ore conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on the ore port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Everyone has access to the 3-for-1 conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on a 3-for-1 port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Pick up one resource of your choice whenever you buy a road.
Pick up one resource of your choice whenever you buy a settlement.
Pick up one resource of your choice whenever you buy a city.
Pick up one resource of your choice whenever you buy a development card.
Everyone can buy roads for 1 less resource of choice.
Everyone can buy settlements for 1 less resource of choice.
Everyone can buy cities for 1 less resource of choice.
Everyone can buy development cards for 1 less resource of choice.
Everyone starts the game by picking up resources for both of their initial settlements.
rules.notes: If both of your initial settlements touch the same time, pick up that resource twice.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to place a free road.
rules.notes: Can be placed at any point, including during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to place a free settlement.
rules.notes: Can be placed at any point, though with default rules it isn’t possible to play this during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to place a free city.
rules.notes: Can be placed at any point, including during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to buy a development card for free.
rules.notes: Can be bought at any point, including during initial settlements.

rules.description: The Longest Road bonus requires 1 less road.
rules.notes: With default rules, Longest Road requires 5 consecutive roads. Reduce this to 4.

rules.description: The Largest Army bonus requires 1 less knight.
rules.notes: With default rules, Largest Army requires 3 face-up knights. Reduce this to 2.

rules.description: Placing any road, settlement or city along the coast requires 1 less resource of your choice.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing any road along the coast requires 1 less resource of your choice.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing any settlement along the coast requires 1 less resource of your choice.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing any city along the coast requires 1 less resource of your choice.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing any road, settlement or city on the desert requires 1 less resource of your choice.
Placing any road on the desert requires 1 less resource of your choice.
Placing any settlement on the desert requires 1 less resource of your choice.
Placing any city on the desert requires 1 less resource of your choice.
Longest Road grants 1 additional victory point.
rules.notes: With default rules, Longest Road grants 2 victory points. Increase this to 3.

rules.description: Largest Army grants 1 additional victory point.
rules.notes: With default rules, Largest Army grants 2 victory points. Increase this to 3.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to re-draw a development card.
rules.notes: Put the development card you drew back in the deck, shuffle, and re-select a card.

rules.description: Any settlements on 2s or 12s are automatically upgraded to cities.
rules.notes: This includes initial settlements.

rules.description: Any settlements on 3s or 11s generate an extra resource for that tile.
rules.notes: This includes initial settlements. Upgrading the settlement to a city will generate 3 resources for that tile.

rules.description: Any settlements on 4s or 10s generate an extra resource for that tile.
rules.notes: This includes initial settlements. Upgrading the settlement to a city will generate 3 resources for that tile.

rules.description: Whenever you steal from someone, predict which resource you will steal. If correct, steal again and repeat.
rules.notes: Max 3 consecutive steals at a time. Does not apply to stealing via Monopoly.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to move the robber and steal, without playing a knight or rolling a 7.
rules.notes: Once per player per game.

rules.description: Players being stolen from can choose which card to give up.
rules.notes: Instead of holding your hand up for the thief to choose a card, hold out one card for them to take.

rules.description: The 2 and 12 tiles count as wild card tiles.
rules.notes: A 'wild card' tile means, each time you pick up resources, you can choose which resource. If you have multiple settlements on a wild card tile, you must pick up all of 1 type of resource.

rules.description: Both 3 tiles count as wild card tiles.
rules.notes: A 'wild card' tile means, each time you pick up resources, you can choose which resource. If you have multiple settlements on a wild card tile, you must pick up all of 1 type of resource.

rules.description: Increase the number of cards required to dump on 7 rolls by 1.
rules.notes: With default rules, you must dump cards if a 7 is rolled and you have 8 or more cards. Increase this to 9.

rules.description: Increase the number of cards required to dump on 7 rolls by 2.
rules.notes: With default rules, you must dump cards if a 7 is rolled and you have 8 or more cards. Increase this to 10.

rules.description: If you place the robber on a tile with multiple players, take a card from 2 of them.
rules.notes: One player settled on a tile multiple times does not count for this rule.

rules.description: If you place the robber on a tile with multiple players, take a card from all of them.
rules.notes: One player settled on a tile multiple times does not count for this rule.

rules.description: When moving the robber, you can place it on the desert to pick up any resource you want. Do not steal from any player if you do.
rules.notes: If you place the robber on the desert, take a resource from the pile instead of from any player.

rules.description: If you roll a 7 and have too many cards, you can place the robber on the desert to avoid dumping. Do not steal from any player if you do.
Green development cards are interchangeable (any green development can be used for any effect).
If you steal Longest Road from a player, steal all resources the player has as well.
rules.notes: This rule does not grant anything if you are the first player to get Longest Road.

rules.description: If you steal Largest Army from a player, steal all resources the player has as well.
rules.notes: This rule does not grant anything if you are the first player to get Largest Army.

rules.description: The Road Building card grants 1 additional road.
rules.notes: With default rules, Road Building grants 2 free roads. Increase this to 3.

rules.description: The Road Building card grants 2 additional roads.
rules.notes: With default rules, Road Building grants 2 free roads. Increase this to 4.

rules.description: The Year of Plenty card grants 1 additional resource.
rules.notes: With default rules, Year of Plenty grants 2 free resources. Increase this to 3.

rules.description: The Year of Plenty card grants 2 additional resources.
rules.notes: With default rules, Year of Plenty grants 2 free resources. Increase this to 4.

rules.description: Yellow development cards grant 1 additional victory point.
rules.notes: With default rules, yellow development cards grant 1 victory point. Increase this to 2.

rules.description: Green development cards go back into the deck after use.
rules.notes: Shuffle the deck after replacing the card.

rules.description: If you settle 3 times on a particular tile, you receive the 2-for-1 port conversion for that resource.
rules.notes: Does not apply to the desert or any wild card tiles.

rules.description: Settling on the desert grants you the 3-for-1 port conversion.
rules.notes: Settling on a 3-for-1 port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Whenever someone plays a Year of Plenty, all other players get to pick up 1 resource of choice as well.
rules.notes: Whoever played the Year of Plenty still picks up the default amount of resources.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 3 wood cards for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 3 brick cards for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 3 sheep cards for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 3 wheat cards for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 3 ore cards for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Everyone has one opportunity to pick up 1 of each resource card for free.
rules.notes: Must all be picked up at once. Once per player per game. Can be done during initial settlements.

rules.description: Encircling a tile with 6 roads counts as an extra settlement on that tile.
rules.notes: This bonus applies regardless of any other settlements on the tile. Grants 1 victory point and an extra resource whenever the tile's number is rolled. There is no way to 'city' this extra settlement.

rules.description: Settling on the desert grants an additional victory point, max 1 per player.
All players choose 1 of their initial settlements to instantly city for free.
Anyone who manages to divide the board in half with a continuous road automatically wins the game.
rules.notes: The road must divide the board so that at least 7 tiles on each side, and block off any other roads from passing (including along the coast).

rules.description: The Longest Road bonus is granted to the top two players with the longest eligible roads, instead of just the leader.
rules.notes: Whoever is in third place can steal the bonus from whoever is in second place. If the top two players are tied, and third place passes both of them, the other two players both lose the bonus. You still need the minimum length road to be eligible.

rules.description: The Largest Army bonus is granted to the top two players with the most played knights, instead of just the leader.
rules.notes: Whoever is in third place can steal the bonus from whoever is in second place. If the top two players are tied, and third place passes both of them, the other two players both lose the bonus. You still need the minimum number of knights to be eligible.

rules.description: Anyone can play 2 development cards in one turn.

title: Power Struggle Rules
description: Rules that generally make players weaker and amp up the friendly competition.

rules.description: The 2-for-1 wood conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on the wood port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: The 2-for-1 brick conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on the brick port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: The 2-for-1 sheep conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on the sheep port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: The 2-for-1 wheat conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on the wheat port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: The 2-for-1 ore conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on the ore port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: The 3-for-1 conversion is disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on a 3-for-1 port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Buying a road costs 1 additional resource of the player’s choice.
Buying a settlement costs 1 additional resource of the player’s choice.
Buying a city costs 1 additional resource of the player’s choice.
Buying a development card costs 1 additional resource of the player’s choice.
Everyone starts the game with zero resources.
The Longest Road bonus costs 1 additional road.
rules.notes: With default rules, Longest Road requires 5 consecutive roads. Increase this to 6.

rules.description: The Largest Army bonus costs 1 additional knight.
rules.notes: With default rules, Largest Army requires 3 face-up knights. Increase this to 4.

rules.description: Buying any roads require you buy no other items that round.
rules.notes: You cannot avoid this rule by buying the other items first. If a player wishes to buy any number of roads, they cannot buy any settlements, cities or development cards that turn.

rules.description: Buying any settlements require you buy no other items that round.
rules.notes: You cannot avoid this rule by buying the other items first. If a player wishes to buy any number of settlements, they cannot buy any roads, settlements or cities that turn.

rules.description: Buying any cities require you buy no other items that round.
rules.notes: You cannot avoid this rule by buying the other items first. If a player wishes to buy a city, they cannot buy any roads, settlements, or development cards that turn.

rules.description: Buying any development cards require you buy no other items that round.
rules.notes: You cannot avoid this rule by buying the other items first. If a player wishes to buy a development card, they cannot buy any roads, settlements, or cities that turn.

rules.description: Each player has one opportunity to call for a 'road ban' at the start of their turn. If declared, nobody can buy any roads on their next turn.
rules.notes: This ban also applies to the player who called for it, on their current turn.

rules.description: Each player has one opportunity to call for a 'settlement ban' at the start of their turn. If declared, nobody can buy any settlements on their next turn.
rules.notes: This ban also applies to the player who called for it, on their current turn.

rules.description: Each player has one opportunity to call for a 'city ban' at the start of their turn. If declared, nobody can buy any cities on their next turn.
rules.notes: This ban also applies to the player who called for it, on their current turn.

rules.description: Each player has one opportunity to call for a 'development card ban' at the start of their turn. If declared, nobody can buy any development cards on their next turn.
rules.notes: This ban also applies to the player who called for it, on their current turn.

rules.description: Each player has one opportunity to call for a 'universal ban' at the start of their turn. If declared, nobody can buy any roads, settlements, cities or development cards on their next turn.
rules.notes: This ban also applies to the player who called for it, on their current turn.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the coast requires an additional wood.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the coast requires an additional brick.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the coast requires an additional sheep.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the coast requires an additional wheat.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the coast requires an additional ore.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Placing a road, settlement or city on the desert requires an additional wood.
Placing a road, settlement or city on the desert requires an additional brick.
Placing a road, settlement or city on the desert requires an additional sheep.
Placing a road, settlement or city on the desert requires an additional wheat.
Placing a road, settlement or city on the desert requires an additional ore.
Whenever you have a card stolen from you, choose another card to discard into the pile.
rules.notes: If you are left with zero cards after being stolen from, ignore this rule.

rules.description: Decrease the number of cards required to dump on 7 rolls by 1.
rules.notes: With default rules, you must dump cards if a 7 is rolled and you have 8 or more cards. Decrease this to 7.

rules.description: Decrease the number of cards required to dump on 7 rolls by 2.
rules.notes: With default rules, you must dump cards if a 7 is rolled and you have 8 or more cards. Decrease this to 6.

rules.description: If you gain Longest Road, discard all of your resources.
rules.notes: This applies to whoever first gains Longest Road, and to whoever subsequently steals it.

rules.description: If you gain Largest Army, discard all of your resources.
rules.notes: This applies to whoever first gains Largest Army, and to whoever subsequently steals it.

rules.description: Monopoly cards must be used to target one person, instead of everyone.
rules.notes: Whoever plays the Monopoly must choose a player to target, as well as the resource to steal.

rules.description: If you are about to lose cards to a Monopoly, dump them in the resource piles instead of giving them to another player.
Nobody can pick up more than 3 resources on a given dice roll.
rules.notes: If you are about to pick up more than 3 resources, choose which ones to keep and which ones to ignore.

rules.description: Nobody can pick up more than 5 resources on a given dice roll.
rules.notes: If you are about to pick up more than 5 resources, choose which ones to keep and which ones to ignore.

rules.description: If you play a knight while already in possession of Largest Army, put the knight back in the deck after use.
rules.notes: Shuffle the deck after replacing the card.

rules.description: No single player can settle on a single tile 3 times.
rules.notes: If multiple people have settled on a tile, that tile can still be settled on a total of 3 times.

rules.description: No tile can be settled on 3 times.
rules.notes: Regardless of who settles there, no tile can contain 3 settlements.

rules.description: If a player is settled on both 6 tiles, they must choose which tile to pick up resources for, each time a 6 is rolled.
rules.notes: Players can still receive multiple resources on a 6 roll, if they have multiple settlements or cities on a single tile.

rules.description: If a player is settled on both 8 tiles, they must choose which tile to pick up resources for, each time a 8 is rolled.
rules.notes: Players can still receive multiple resources on a 8 roll, if they have multiple settlements or cities on a single tile.

rules.description: Players cannot settle on both 6 tiles.
Players cannot settle on both 8 tiles.
Players cannot buy multiple roads on one turn.
rules.notes: Players can still buy one road, and any number of settlements, cities or development cards each turn.

rules.description: Players cannot buy multiple development cards on one turn.
rules.notes: Players can still buy one development card, and any number of roads, settlements, or cities each turn.

rules.description: Any player who hits 9 victory points must discard all of their resources.
rules.notes: This can happen multiple times if a player drops back below 9 points.

rules.description: No one player can place 4 roads adjacent to a single tile.
rules.notes: This applies to any tile including the desert. This does not put any limit on the number of settlements or cities on any tile.

rules.description: Each player must have one initial settlements on either the coast or the desert.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: Players can only buy a city if they also buy a road, settlement, or development card that turn.
Players cannot buy any roads on turns where they play a green development card.
Players cannot buy any settlements on turns where they play a green development card.
Players cannot buy any cities on turns where they play a green development card.
Players cannot buy any development cards on turns where they play a green development card.
A player using a Monopoly must receive at least 1 resource from all players, otherwise the Monopoly is ignored.
rules.notes: If the player does not receive a card from every other player, put the Monopoly back in the deck and shuffle.

rules.description: A player using a Road Building cannot buy any additional roads that turn.
rules.notes: The player can still buy settlements, cities and development cards.

rules.description: The Longest Road bonus is disabled.
The Largest Army bonus is disabled.
Once any player settles on a 3-for-1 port, the remaining 3-for-1 ports are disabled.
rules.notes: Settling on a 3-for-1 port is still allowed, but it won’t give any additional benefit.

rules.description: Each player can only have 1 settlement on the coast.
rules.notes: 'Coast' means any spot adjacent to the water at the edge of the board.

rules.description: 6 and 8 tiles can only be settled on twice each.
Drink whenever you pick up wood.
rules.notes: Does not include stealing resources. If you pick up multiple at once, just drink once.

rules.description: Drink whenever you pick up brick.
rules.notes: Does not include stealing resources. If you pick up multiple at once, just drink once.

rules.description: Drink whenever you pick up sheep.
rules.notes: Does not include stealing resources. If you pick up multiple at once, just drink once.

rules.description: Drink whenever you pick up wheat.
rules.notes: Does not include stealing resources. If you pick up multiple at once, just drink once.

rules.description: Drink whenever you pick up ore.
rules.notes: Does not include stealing resources. If you pick up multiple at once, just drink once.

rules.description: Drink whenever you have a card stolen from you.
If you currently hold the Longest Road, pick someone to drink every time you place another road.
rules.notes: The additional road does not have to contribute to your longest road.

rules.description: If you currently hold the Largest Army, pick someone to drink every time you play another knight.
Drink every time you buy a road.
Drink every time you buy a settlement.
Drink every time you buy a city.
Drink every time you buy a development card.
Drink every time any other player buys a road.
Drink every time any other player buys a settlement.
Drink every time any other player buys a city.
Drink every time any other player buys a development card.
Drink whenever you fail to pick up any resources on your own dice roll.
rules.notes: This includes if the robber prevented you from picking up any resources.

rules.description: Drink whenever you fail to pick up any resources on any 5 or 6 roll.
rules.notes: This includes if the robber prevented you from picking up any resources.

rules.description: Drink whenever you fail to pick up any resources on any 8 or 9 roll.
rules.notes: This includes if the robber prevented you from picking up any resources.

rules.description: Finish your drink whenever you fail to pick up any resources on any 2 or 12 roll.
rules.notes: This includes if the robber prevented you from picking up any resources.

rules.description: The last player to roll a 7 is Question Master.
rules.notes: The Question Master's job is to ask other players questions. Any player who responds with an answer has to drink. When a new player rolls a 7, the old Question Master.

rules.description: Whenever a 3 or 11 is rolled, start a waterfall with the player who rolled it.
rules.notes: A 'waterfall' is a drinking game where 1 person starts drinking, then the next person (clockwise) begins after player 1. Player 1 doesn’t stop drinking until all remaining players have started. Then, in a clockwise fashion, each player stops drinking one after another.

rules.description: Whenever a 2 or 12 is rolled, start a waterfall with the player who rolled it.
rules.notes: A 'waterfall' is a drinking game where 1 person starts drinking, then the next person (clockwise) begins after player 1. Player 1 doesn’t stop drinking until all remaining players have started. Then, in a clockwise fashion, each player stops drinking one after another.

rules.description: Whenever you earn a victory point, pick someone to drink.
The last player to 3 points has to finish their drink.
rules.notes: If multiple players never reach this point total, they all finish their drinks after the game.

rules.description: The first player to 3 points picks a player to finish their drink.
The last player to 5 points has to finish their drink.
rules.notes: If multiple players never reach this point total, they all finish their drinks after the game.

rules.description: The first player to 5 points picks a player to finish their drink.
The last player to 7 points has to finish their drink.
rules.notes: If multiple players never reach this point total, they all finish their drinks after the game.

rules.description: The first player to 7 points picks a player to finish their drink.
Agree as a group on a number between 3 and 9. The last player to reach that point total has to finish their drink.
rules.notes: If multiple players never reach this point total, they all finish their drinks after the game.

rules.description: Agree as a group on a number between 3 and 9. The first player to reach that point picks a player to finish their drink.
Whenever you’re about to steal a resource from someone, predict which resource you will get. If correct, the other player drinks. If incorrect, you drink.
Whenever someone is about to steal a resource from you, predict which resource they will get. If correct, the other player drinks. If incorrect, you drink.
Whenever a player rolls a 7, they pick another player to be drinking partners (until the next 7 is rolled).
rules.notes: Drinking partners simply drink whenever their partner is required to drink.

rules.description: Finish your drink whenever playing a green development card.
Finish your drink whenever you receive a yellow development card.
If someone steals Longest Road from you, finish your drink.
If someone steals Largest Army from you, finish your drink.
Whenever you roll a 7, name a resource. Every player with at least 1 of those resources drinks.
rules.notes: You can make this prediction prior to stealing a resource, to get more information.

rules.description: Drink whenever utilizing a port conversion.
If you pick up 4 or more resources on a single roll, drink.
If you pick up 4 or more resources on a single roll, choose someone to drink.
Placing any road, settlement or city on the board must be done with the player's off hand. Drink if you forget to do so.
Picking up any resource or development cards must be done with the player's off hand. Drink if you forget to do so.
Moving the robber must be done with the player's off hand. Drink if you forget to do so.
Finish your drink if another player turns one of your roads into a dead end.
rules.notes: A road can be made into a dead end by either settling at the end of it, or building 2 roads at the junction.

rules.description: Players must pass the dice to the next player one at a time. Drink if you forget to do so.
Players must roll the dice one at a time. Drink if you forget to do so.
If a player manages to divide the board in half with a continuous road, everyone else must finish their drink.
rules.notes: The road must divide the board so that at least 7 tiles on each side, and block off any other roads from passing (including along the coast).

rules.description: If you use up all available roads, settlements or cities, finish your drink.
Drink if every player except you picks up resources on a given roll.
rules.notes: This includes if the robber prevented you from picking up any resources.

rules.description: Drink whenever you miss out on picking up resources due to the robber.
Play music during your game. Whenever the song changes, everyone drinks.
Any player with 8 or more victory points must drink whenever picking up resources.
Any player with 4 or less victory points must drink whenever picking up resources.
If the game runs out of development cards, everyone must finish their drink.
If the game runs out of any type of resource, everyone must finish their drink.
rules.notes: Can occur multiple times.

rules.description: If someone rolls the same number as the previous roll, everyone must drink.
rules.notes: Can occur multiple times in a row.

title: Custom Rules
description: Create your own rules to play with!
